DataframeSave.KitText: #> DataframeSave --exampleTitle Save Dataframe to CSV Using Default Name --example Use the DataframeSave kit to export the current dataframe to a CSV file. If no file name is given, the dataframe is saved using its variable name. In this case, the dataframe appleStockDf will be saved as appleStockDf.csv.
DataframeSave.ExampleDescription: Use the DataframeSave kit to export the current dataframe to a CSV file. If no file name is given, the dataframe is saved using its variable name. In this case, the dataframe appleStockDf will be saved as appleStockDf.csv.
DataframeSave.ExampleTitle: Save Dataframe to CSV Using Default Name

DataframeSave.KitText: #> DataframeSave --fileName NewAppleStock.csv --exampleTitle Save Dataframe with Custom File Name --example You can choose a custom file name when saving a dataframe to a CSV file. In this example, the dataframe is saved as NewAppleStock.csv instead of using the variable name.
DataframeSave.ExampleDescription: You can choose a custom file name when saving a dataframe to a CSV file. In this example, the dataframe is saved as NewAppleStock.csv instead of using the variable name.
DataframeSave.ExampleTitle: Save Dataframe with Custom File Name

DataframeSave.KitText: #> DataframeSave --fileName SecondNewAppleStock --exampleTitle Save Dataframe Without Specifying File Extension --example If you leave off the .csv extension in the file name, it will still be added automatically. This makes it easier to quickly save a file by name without worrying about file format details.
DataframeSave.ExampleDescription: If you leave off the .csv extension in the file name, it will still be added automatically. This makes it easier to quickly save a file by name without worrying about file format details.
DataframeSave.ExampleTitle: Save Dataframe Without Specifying File Extension
